name: Boudicca

attributes.attribute: called out to war goddess Andraste

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A British heroine of the name Boudicca (also known as Boudica, Boadicea) achieved a status close to that of a legend due to her war against the invading Romans. She initiated the conflict soon after the destruction of the significant Druid sanctuary located on the island of Anglesey. The Roman invasion fell heavily on her people, the Iceni of southeastern Britain. After her daughters' rape and her husband's death, Boudicca rallied her people and their supporters to launch a powerful, albeit ultimately unsuccessful, campaign. Observing the treatment given to captive queens, Boudicca took her life when defeated, calling out the name of the war goddess Andraste at the moment of death.
